unnormalised: EdTech Boost: Scholarship Portals See Surge in Usage
normalised: EdTech Boost: Scholarship Portals See Surge in Usage

unnormalised: New Delhi – Online scholarship portals are experiencing a significant surge in traffic as students across India gear up for the academic year. These platforms, designed to connect deserving students with financial aid opportunities, are becoming increasingly vital in making higher education accessible.
normalised: New Delhi – Online scholarship portals are experiencing a significant surge in traffic as students across India gear up for the academic year. These platforms, designed to connect deserving students with financial aid opportunities, are becoming increasingly vital in making higher education accessible.

unnormalised: Many portals are reporting a 30% increase in registrations compared to last year, especially from students in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities like Patna and Lucknow. The rise is attributed to increased awareness campaigns and improved accessibility through mobile apps.
normalised: Many portals are reporting a thirty percent increase in registrations compared to last year, especially from students in Tier-two and Tier-three cities like Patna and Lucknow. The rise is attributed to increased awareness campaigns and improved accessibility through mobile apps.

unnormalised: “We’ve seen a phenomenal response,” says Priya Sharma, CEO of 'Vidya Dhan,' a leading scholarship portal. "Many students are using this platform to explore options as tuition fees keep mounting."

unnormalised: The deadline for several national-level scholarships like the 'Inspire Scholarship' are fast approaching, contributing to the rush. Several platforms even include scholarships aimed at supporting minority communities.
